definition: the quick-footed climb up first (idiom)/the early bird catches the worm/first come, first served
Czech/Czech Republic/abbr. for 捷克[Jie2 ke4]
variant of 捷[jie2]/quick/nimble
victory/triumph/quick/nimble/prompt
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample
early/prior/former/in advance/first

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

sentences.english: We arrived early at the theatre so as to preempt the front seats.
sentences.chinese: 我们早早来到剧院，以便捷足先登占到前排座位。

sentences.english: Fine. When I beat you to it, don't come whining to me like a dog.
sentences.chinese: 好啊，等我捷足先登的时候，可别像狗一样来求我。

sentences.english: And, once again this year, he's first.
sentences.chinese: 今年它又一次捷足先登。

definition: to covet/to long for/to lust after
to rob sb of sth they cherish (idiom)
lit. Cheng Yaojin ambushes the enemy (saying)/fig. sb shows up unexpectedly and disrupts the plan/sb whose presence is regarded as irksome
pinyin: ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 ge4 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1

definition: key moment/decisive opportunity
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
the pavilion closest to the water enjoys moonlight first (idiom)/to benefit from intimacy with an influential person
pinyin: jin4 shui3 lou2 tai2 xian1 de2 yue4

definition: lit. a pavilion near the water (idiom); fig. using one's proximity to the powerful to obtain favor
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to play tricks on/to make a fool of
to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
to upset the apple cart/to disrupt things
to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
see 半路殺出個程咬金|半路杀出个程咬金[ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 ge4 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1]
pinyin: ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 de5 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1

definition: to seize (the strategic high ground)
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to plunder/to pillage/to forcibly take
